alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 4:31PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with gusty winds will impact portions of Hunterdon, Camden, Mercer, northern Gloucester, northwestern Burlington, Somerset, western Middlesex, southeastern Montgomery, Bucks, east central Chester, Philadelphia and Delaware Counties through 515 PM EST... At 430 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers with strong gusty winds along a cold front extending from near Bloomsbury to near Chalfont to Concordville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Camden, New Brunswick, West Chester, Somerville, Gloucester City, Somerset, Edison, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, East Brunswick, Evesham, Bridgewater, South Brunswick, Mount Laurel, North Brunswick, Ewing, Norristown and Chester. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 3 and 10. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 320 and 359. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 30. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 40. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 42. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 76. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 22. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Gloucester; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington
